2025-01-01.history: Celebrates Mary’s divine maternity as Mother of Jesus, the Prince of Peace.

2025-01-02.saint: Sts. Basil the Great and Gregory Nazianzen
2025-01-02.history: Fourth-century bishops and Doctors of the Church, known for defending orthodoxy.

2025-01-03.history: Devotion to the holy name of Jesus emphasizes His saving power.

2025-01-04.history: First native-born American saint, founder of the Sisters of Charity.

2025-01-05.history: Celebrates Christ revealed to the nations, symbolized by the visit of the Magi.

2025-01-06.history: Canadian brother known for his humility and devotion to St. Joseph.

2025-01-07.history: Dominican priest, patron of canon lawyers.

2025-01-12.history: Marks the end of the Christmas season; Jesus is revealed as Son of God.

2025-01-13.history: Fourth-century bishop and Doctor of the Church, defender against Arianism.

2025-01-20.saint: St. Fabian, Pope and Martyr; St. Sebastian
2025-01-20.history: Fabian was a pope and martyr; Sebastian, a Roman soldier martyred for Christ.

2025-01-21.history: Young Roman martyr, model of purity and courage.

2025-01-22.saint: Day of Prayer for the Legal Protection of Unborn Children (USA)
2025-01-22.history: A day of penance and prayer for the unborn.

2025-01-23.saint: St. Vincent, Deacon and Martyr; St. Marianne Cope
2025-01-23.history: Vincent was a Spanish martyr; Marianne served lepers in Hawaii.

2025-01-24.history: Bishop and Doctor, known for his gentleness and spiritual writings.

2025-01-25.history: Celebrates Paul’s dramatic conversion on the road to Damascus.

2025-01-26.history: Also observed as Sunday of the Word of God.

2025-01-27.history: Founder of the Ursulines, dedicated to the education of girls.

2025-01-28.history: Dominican priest and Doctor of the Church, one of the greatest theologians.

2025-01-31.history: Priest, educator, and founder of the Salesians.
